PAD_RefuseSupremeTadpole.synopsis: Companion characters can't use the supreme tadpole, as only the avatar can choose to transform into a Mind Flayer. They respond in rejection to using the tadpole when the player trys to make them use it. The exception being Karlach, who can transform but needs the avatar to make that decision.
PAD_RefuseSupremeTadpole.how_to_trigger: oe end_supremetadpolegive supreme tadpole to non-avatar characterUse the supreme tadpole item

TrueSoulCorpse.synopsis: The player witnesses an invasive parasite emerge from a dead body - the very same kind of parasite that currently resides inside them. They try to kill it, but find this curiously difficult - the little creature can psychically influence the player and tries to sway them from doing it harm. Meanwhile, Daisy encourages us to harvest it to absorb its potential.
TrueSoulCorpse.how_to_trigger: Loot the tadpole from a True Soul corpse for the first time.

UseSupremeTadpole.synopsis: The player made the choice to become a Mind Flayer, but held off on transforming right away, so the Emperor gave them a supreme tadpole to use when they decided to make the switch.Using the supreme tadpole item will trigger this dialog, which can happen in and out of combat.
UseSupremeTadpole.how_to_trigger: oe end_supremetadpoleuse the supreme tadpoleThree different context:Out of CombatIn CombatOn the Netherbrain (oe brainbattle)

PAD_Refusal.synopsis: When the player clicks on a tadpole but this character has not been convinced to consume tadpoles

PAD_RefusalBeforeDaisy.synopsis: Character reactions when they try to use an item that cannot be currently used.

UseAstralTadpole.synopsis: The player uses the Astral-touched tadpole from their inventory and transforms into a partial-illithid.

DaisyAD_TadpoleOnTrueSoulCorpse.synopsis: Daisy speaks as a voice in our heads on approaching the dead body of a True Soul.
DaisyAD_TadpoleOnTrueSoulCorpse.how_to_trigger: Kill a character with an ILLITHID tag (corpse will contain a tadpole). If no one else is speaking and the player can see the tadpole from the corpse, Daisy will say this AD.

PAD_DroppedSupremeTadpole.synopsis: The player just dropped the supreme tadpole, the item needed to transform into a Mind Flayer to beat the Netherbrain! Pretty important stuff. The player will make a comment and a marker will appear on the map.
PAD_DroppedSupremeTadpole.how_to_trigger: get the supreme tadpole through debugdrop it

DaisyAD_TadpoleInJar.synopsis: Daisy speaks as a voice in our heads when spotting a jar containing a tadpole.
DaisyAD_TadpoleInJar.how_to_trigger: Spot a tadpole jar (root UNI_TadpolePowerJar_1ec327be-3b7f-4502-9586-860e057e09ae ). If no one else is speaking and the player can see the jar, Daisy will say this AD.

Consume.synopsis: Daisy wants you to consume the tadpole in your inventory to increase your illithid powers
Consume.how_to_trigger: Triggers when True Soul tadpole gets added to inventory.

PAD_RefuseSupremeTadpole_0.speaker: Player
PAD_RefuseSupremeTadpole_0.text: Eh, no thank you. Minsc is full. So is Boo.

PAD_RefuseSupremeTadpole_1.speaker: Player
PAD_RefuseSupremeTadpole_1.text: This is not for Minsc to use. Boo, he likes my face too much.

PAD_TadpoleOnTrueSoulCorpse_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_TadpoleOnTrueSoulCorpse_0.text: *There's life within the corpse yet - a tadpole, still fighting to survive.*

TrueSoulCorpse_7.speaker: Narrator
TrueSoulCorpse_7.text: *Something stirs behind the corpse's eye - something alive. It breaks to the surface, plops to the ground, and quickly squirms away.*

TrueSoulCorpse_29.speaker: Narrator
TrueSoulCorpse_29.text: *A strange power resonates within the corpse. It calls to you.*
TrueSoulCorpse_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player puts a finger to their temple - a hint of mindmeld happening to them.

TrueSoulCorpse_14.text: You know what to do. Don't be afraid.
TrueSoulCorpse_14.context: NodeContext: spoken telepathically, Daisy not physically present

TrueSoulCorpse_6.speaker: Narrator
TrueSoulCorpse_6.text: *Most corpses feel like toys before you. To be played with, and discarded when you tire.*
TrueSoulCorpse_6.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player jerks their hand up. 
True Soul corpse floats up into frame.

TrueSoulCorpse_15.speaker: Narrator
TrueSoulCorpse_15.text: *But this body seems different. A friend calls out from the corpse, desperate to be freed.*

TrueSoulCorpse_25.speaker: Player
TrueSoulCorpse_25.text: Embrace the desire to commune with the tadpole. Will it to break free.

TrueSoulCorpse_27.speaker: Player
TrueSoulCorpse_27.text: Let your curiosity guide you. Free the tadpole.

TrueSoulCorpse_28.speaker: Player
TrueSoulCorpse_28.text: The tadpole is trying to influence you. Resist.

TrueSoulCorpse_16.text: Follow your instincts. Don't be afraid.
TrueSoulCorpse_16.context: NodeContext: spoken telepathically, Daisy not physically present

TrueSoulCorpse_10.speaker: Narrator
TrueSoulCorpse_10.text: *Your limbs move of their own accord - there's something of value here. Something your mind craves.*
TrueSoulCorpse_10.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player jerks their hand up. 
True Soul corpse floats up into frame.

TrueSoulCorpse_12.speaker: Narrator
TrueSoulCorpse_12.text: *Why let its host's memories go to waste? The tadpole has absorbed it all. Its experience could nourish you, strengthen you.*

TrueSoulCorpse_19.speaker: Player
TrueSoulCorpse_19.text: Let your body guide you - welcome the tadpole's influence.

TrueSoulCorpse_5.speaker: Player
TrueSoulCorpse_5.text: The tadpole is toying with you. Resist it.

TrueSoulCorpse_2.speaker: Narrator
TrueSoulCorpse_2.text: *Your muscles loosen. The tadpole breaks free of its deceased host. Your mind is your own again. For now.*
TrueSoulCorpse_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tadpole bursts out of the corpse's eye. The player drops the levitating corpse, exhausted from the effort of fighting their own compulsion.

TrueSoulCorpse_23.speaker: Narrator
TrueSoulCorpse_23.text: You're not ready. It's all right.

TrueSoulCorpse_17.speaker: Narrator
TrueSoulCorpse_17.text: *No use. Compulsion takes over - your actions are no longer your own.*

TrueSoulCorpse_22.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A jerk of the player's hand.
Corpse's neck twists and snaps. 
Tadpole psionically bursts out and floats to player. 
Body collapses below frame.

TrueSoulCorpse_21.speaker: Player
TrueSoulCorpse_21.text: Force your mind shut. You will not be influenced by an illithid parasite.

UseSupremeTadpole_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player retrieves the supreme tadpole from their inventory. The tadpole levitates in their palm.

UseSupremeTadpole_69.speaker: Narrator
UseSupremeTadpole_69.text: *A fierce thing, burning with potential, primed for absorption - it feels the pull of the Netherbrain, but its attention rests on you.*

UseSupremeTadpole_46.speaker: Orpheus
UseSupremeTadpole_46.text: Remember - you have to be illithid to wield the Netherstones. Now is the time. Absorb the parasite's potential. Evolve.

UseSupremeTadpole_2.speaker: Orpheus
UseSupremeTadpole_2.text: Now is the moment - make the sacrifice. Become ghaik, and wield the stones!

UseSupremeTadpole_22.speaker: Karlach
UseSupremeTadpole_22.text: Wait. There's another way. You know what's waiting for me - nothing but oblivion. This could be my last good deed.

UseSupremeTadpole_38.speaker: Karlach
UseSupremeTadpole_38.text: Let me do this for you. For me. Please, darling. I want to.

UseSupremeTadpole_58.speaker: Karlach
UseSupremeTadpole_58.text: Wait. You don't have to do this. There's another option - me.

UseSupremeTadpole_1.speaker: Karlach
UseSupremeTadpole_1.text: I'm dying. My heart feels like a live grenade - gonna blow any minute. You still have a life to live. I don't.

UseSupremeTadpole_40.speaker: Player
UseSupremeTadpole_40.text: This is my sacrifice to make. Not yours.

UseSupremeTadpole_35.speaker: Karlach
UseSupremeTadpole_35.text: But it isn't a sacrifice. Not to me. I... I'm dying. This thing in my chest is burning me through.

UseSupremeTadpole_33.speaker: Karlach
UseSupremeTadpole_33.text: You always were sensible. This heart inside me is about to blow. Doesn't matter which body it obliterates, right?

UseSupremeTadpole_27.speaker: Karlach
UseSupremeTadpole_27.text: If this is the end for me, let me be the motherfucker who saved the world.

UseSupremeTadpole_49.speaker: Player
UseSupremeTadpole_49.text: All right. If this is what you really want, all I can say is thank you.

UseSupremeTadpole_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach closes their eyes, a mindmeld effect takes over. Karlach transforms into a mind flayer. See: END_IllithidOptions_Assimilation for animation of the same moment.

UseSupremeTadpole_59.speaker: Karlach
UseSupremeTadpole_59.text: You'll still love me when I've got a face full of tentacles, right?

UseSupremeTadpole_30.speaker: Karlach
UseSupremeTadpole_30.text: You'll still go drinking with me when I've got a face full of tentacles, right?

UseSupremeTadpole_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach closes their eyes, a mindmeld effect takes over. Karlach transforms into a mind flayer.

UseSupremeTadpole_18.speaker: Karlach
UseSupremeTadpole_18.text: Well would you look at that. If I had a bit more time, I think I could get used to this.
UseSupremeTadpole_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach admires their new mind flayer form. NodeContext: Good spirited

UseSupremeTadpole_43.speaker: Player
UseSupremeTadpole_43.text: No, Karlach. This is for me to do. I'll embrace the parasite - I'll evolve.

UseSupremeTadpole_12.speaker: Karlach
UseSupremeTadpole_12.text: I know you. I know you know your own mind. If this is what you want, then all I can say is give 'em Hell, soldier.

UseSupremeTadpole_17.speaker: Player
UseSupremeTadpole_17.text: No - neither of us is turning into a mind flayer. Not now.

UseSupremeTadpole_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes their eyes, a mindmeld effect takes over. Player transforms into a mind flayer. See: END_IllithidOptions_Assimilation for animation of the same moment.

UseSupremeTadpole_21.speaker: Narrator
UseSupremeTadpole_21.text: *Your pulse quickens through veins, nerves, thoughts, rising to a fever pitch.*

UseSupremeTadpole_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player transforms into a mind flayer

UseSupremeTadpole_28.speaker: Narrator
UseSupremeTadpole_28.text: *Your mind and body swell as one. You are who you always were, but infinitely better.*
UseSupremeTadpole_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player admires their new mind flayer form.

UseSupremeTadpole_68.speaker: Orpheus
UseSupremeTadpole_68.text: What are you doing? You cannot wield the Netherstones if you are not a mind flayer.

UseSupremeTadpole_37.text: This might be your last opportunity to evolve - do it. Now.

UseSupremeTadpole_36.speaker: Player
UseSupremeTadpole_36.text: Karlach, if you really want to do this, all I can say is 'thank you.'

UseSupremeTadpole_13.speaker: Orpheus
UseSupremeTadpole_13.text: Is'tark. You are putting us at risk!

UseSupremeTadpole_57.speaker: Orpheus
UseSupremeTadpole_57.text: What are you waiting for? You cannot wield the Netherstones unless you become a mind flayer.

UseSupremeTadpole_41.speaker: Orpheus
UseSupremeTadpole_41.text: Do the honourable thing - make the sacrifice. Now.

UseSupremeTadpole_55.speaker: Narrator
UseSupremeTadpole_55.text: *A fierce thing, burning with potential - it feels your burden, your strife. It wants to evolve you.*

UseSupremeTadpole_29.speaker: Orpheus
UseSupremeTadpole_29.text: Do it. Do it now. Evolve.

UseSupremeTadpole_9.speaker: Orpheus
UseSupremeTadpole_9.text: Gith'ka tavkim krash'ht. Your sacrifice will not be forgotten.

UseSupremeTadpole_44.speaker: Narrator
UseSupremeTadpole_44.text: *A gentle thing, full of promise, full of potential. It wants to evolve you.*

UseSupremeTadpole_61.text: Go on - open your mind to it. Complete your evolution. Become illithid.

UseSupremeTadpole_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Companion hands the player the tadpole the supreme tadpole from their inventory. This can be off-screen. it's an edge case.InternalNodeContext: This is if a companion is the one who used the tadpole.

PAD_Refusal_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Refusal_0.text: *This character does not wish to consume tadpoles.*

PAD_RefusalBeforeDaisy_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_RefusalBeforeDaisy_0.text: *The parasite is stubborn - it refuses both to leave or to allow itself to be used as you desire.*

UseAstralTadpole_1.speaker: Narrator
UseAstralTadpole_1.text: *Life pulses from within - the parasite's thoughts whisper at the edge of your mind.*
UseAstralTadpole_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player takes Astral-touched tadpole out of inventory and looks at it.

UseAstralTadpole_19.speaker: Narrator
UseAstralTadpole_19.text: *It wants to share itself with you - it wants to be let in.*

UseAstralTadpole_15.text: Go on. Don't be afraid. It only wants to help you evolve.

UseAstralTadpole_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player tilts their head back and drops the stone in. The Emperor looks disconcerted by this.

UseAstralTadpole_16.speaker: Player
UseAstralTadpole_16.text: Drop it on the ground and crush it.

UseAstralTadpole_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player drops the tadpole on the ground in anticipation of stomping on it.

UseAstralTadpole_6.text: Wait! Remember - it has enough vitality to nourish you and your allies.

UseAstralTadpole_5.text: Commune with it. You'll see - it only wants to help you.

UseAstralTadpole_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player picks up tadpole from the ground. (We don't need to see contact.)

UseAstralTadpole_38.speaker: Narrator
UseAstralTadpole_38.text: *A coldness seeps through your veins as the tadpole awakens, its yearning almost unbearable. Your mind is a veritable feast.*
UseAstralTadpole_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the inert stone that contains the astral-touched tadpole glowing with life at its core.

UseAstralTadpole_36.speaker: Narrator
UseAstralTadpole_36.text: *The tadpole's essence courses through you - where it touches, your flesh, glands, organs contract and flood with pure thought.*
UseAstralTadpole_36.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Same as in INT_EmperorRevealed_AfterOrpheus, but location-agnostic. 

The player transforms into a partial-illithid. Veins light up under the skin as the transformation makes its way around their body. They observe their own body parts as it works its way around.

UseAstralTadpole_14.speaker: Narrator
UseAstralTadpole_14.text: *You feel different - powerful. Your strength and intellect enhanced. Your mind braced to survive.*
UseAstralTadpole_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player quickly looks over their new form, before bracing to rejoin combat.

UseAstralTadpole_35.speaker: Narrator
UseAstralTadpole_35.text: *You feel... different. Your body has never felt more connected. Your mind present in every flex of a joint or muscle.*
UseAstralTadpole_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: The transformation is over. The player opens their eyes and takes in the change in their skin with surprise, but not displeasure.

UseAstralTadpole_7.text: But if you had opened your mind to it rather than consuming it, your allies could have taken advantage of its power as well.

UseAstralTadpole_28.text: Perhaps once the others see what you can do, they will consider trying it for themselves.

UseAstralTadpole_10.speaker: Player
UseAstralTadpole_10.text: Ignore the Emperor - proceed to stomp on the tadpole.

UseAstralTadpole_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stomps the astral-touched tadpole into pieces.

UseAstralTadpole_27.text: Disappointing. You have lowered our chances of success with your actions.

UseAstralTadpole_37.speaker: Narrator
UseAstralTadpole_37.text: *The tadpole screams for growth with painful intensity. It has been starved - of life, of purpose. It welcomes your probing like a void waiting to be filled.*
UseAstralTadpole_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: A mindmeldy effect over next few nodes

UseAstralTadpole_2.speaker: Narrator
UseAstralTadpole_2.text: *If you let it, it will evolve you, just as the Emperor said.*

UseAstralTadpole_17.speaker: Narrator
UseAstralTadpole_17.text: *Your thoughts swirl with possibility - your body strengthened, your mind bolstered, your very self expanded. All within your reach if you open your mind to the parasite.*

UseAstralTadpole_31.speaker: Narrator
UseAstralTadpole_31.text: *The tadpole prickles with excitement, its thoughts rampant and chaotic in its rush to communicate with you. It is impossible to discern any single intention.*

UseAstralTadpole_29.speaker: Player
UseAstralTadpole_29.text: Put it away  - out of sight, out of mind.

UseAstralTadpole_30.speaker: Narrator
UseAstralTadpole_30.text: *As you tuck the tadpole away, you feel a fleeting disappointment. It wanted so desperately to commune with you.*

UseAstralTadpole_11.text: Now is the time. It wants to evolve you. Don't be afraid - the transformation will only be partial, and you will benefit from it greatly.
UseAstralTadpole_11.context: NodeContext: a pause mid-combat, so the line should be urgent, but confident

UseAstralTadpole_40.speaker: Player
UseAstralTadpole_40.text: Put the tadpole away - you don't need it right now.

UseAstralTadpole_18.speaker: Narrator
UseAstralTadpole_18.text: *The stone is cold - the parasite within is unresponsive. It has nothing more to give you.*
UseAstralTadpole_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player takes Astral-touched tadpole out of inventory and looks at it.

UseAstralTadpole_21.speaker: Narrator
UseAstralTadpole_21.text: *It's just a rock, shaped like a parasite. It has nothing to offer you.*
UseAstralTadpole_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player takes Astral-touched tadpole out of inventory and looks at it.

DaisyAD_TadpoleOnTrueSoulCorpse_0.text: Another parasite. Take it. It will nourish you.

DaisyAD_TadpoleOnTrueSoulCorpse_1.text: Interesting - the host is dead, but the parasite is still alive.

DaisyAD_TadpoleOnTrueSoulCorpse_2.text: There's a parasite in that corpse, brimming with potent magic.

DaisyAD_TadpoleOnTrueSoulCorpse_3.text: A parasite - you should harvest it. You can use it to expand your mind.

DaisyAD_TadpoleOnTrueSoulCorpse_4.text: There's an illithid parasite in that corpse. You should take a look.

DaisyAD_TadpoleOnTrueSoulCorpse_6.text: A True Soul parasite, and it's still alive. You should collect it from the corpse.

DaisyAD_TadpoleOnTrueSoulCorpse_7.text: Another illithid parasite. You should take it.

DaisyAD_TadpoleOnTrueSoulCorpse_8.text: Another parasite - collect it. It might be useful.

DaisyAD_TadpoleOnTrueSoulCorpse_9.text: A True Soul parasite. You can absorb its potential like you did before.

PAD_DroppedSupremeTadpole_0.speaker: Player
PAD_DroppedSupremeTadpole_0.text: Slippery thing. Need to get a hold of it.

PAD_DroppedSupremeTadpole_1.speaker: Player
PAD_DroppedSupremeTadpole_1.text: Not a good time to lose that tadpole...

DaisyAD_TadpoleInJar_0.text: Another parasite. Take it. It will nourish you.

DaisyAD_TadpoleInJar_1.text: A parasite, brimming with magic. Take it.

DaisyAD_TadpoleInJar_2.text: A parasite - take it. You can use it to expand your mind.

DaisyAD_TadpoleInJar_3.text: A parasite - take it. It might be useful.

DaisyAD_TadpoleInJar_4.text: There's something in that vessel. Take a closer look.

DaisyAD_TadpoleInJar_5.text: That vessel contains a parasite. You should take it.

DaisyAD_TadpoleInJar_6.text: Another illithid parasite. You should take it.

DaisyAD_TadpoleInJar_7.text: There's a parasite nearby - you should take a closer look.

DaisyAD_TadpoleInJar_8.text: A True Soul parasite - take it. You can absorb its potential.

Consume_1.text: This one is a True Soul parasite. It can enhance you.

Consume_3.text: You can absorb its potential. Open your mind to it - you already know how.

Consume_6.speaker: Narrator
Consume_6.text: *The tadpole offers psionic powers, drawn not from the Weave but the latent potential of your own mind. Such power lies beyond Mystra's control. And beyond her permission.*

Consume_9.speaker: Player
Consume_9.text: Open your mind to the tadpole.

Consume_7.speaker: Narrator
Consume_7.text: *Your mind swells as it subsumes everything the tadpole has to offer - everything it was, and everything it was destined to be. Pure potential, pure power.*
Consume_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: A mindmeldy effect as the player absorbs the power from the tadpole.

Consume_8.text: Good. You have grown your power and improved your chances of survival.

Consume_0.text: You're afraid. But you needn't be. I'll protect you.

Consume_4.speaker: Player
Consume_4.text: Close your mind. Keep the parasite out.

Consume_2.text: Disappointing. You will need to overcome this resistance if you wish to survive.
